div.head: ¶ Vnto the troubles and sorrowes of the worthy Knight Sir William Leighton.

lg.l: CHrists yoake is sweet, see how it workes the Heart,
with steam's of sigh's, with throw's of suppcation,
Say Well-i am, whē griefes Leight-on my part.
soul's are sublim'd, in fire of tribulation.
No meruaile Marble weepes on gloomy day:
Since griefe yeeldes Hunny dewes, griefe to allay.
